creator: aw@ivtweb.com
text:
The W3C <pattern> SVG sample discussed below is not rendered properly by the 
Batik viewer.  An empty ellipse is displayed.
http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/pservers.html#ExamplePattern01

I tried my own simpler example, and it renders one instance of the fill pattern 
(it does not tile it).

creator: aw@ivtweb.com

simple rectangle pattern fill

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
In the latest SVG specification the example has been changed to
reflect some changes in the handling of units(?).

The new example works properly in Batik looks like:

<?xml version="1.0" standalone="no"?>
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 20001102//EN" 
  "http://www.w3.org/TR/2000/CR-SVG-20001102/DTD/svg-20001102.dtd">
<svg width="8cm" height="4cm" viewBox="0 0 800 400">
  <defs>
    <pattern id="TrianglePattern" patternUnits="userSpaceOnUse"
             x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100"
             viewBox="0 0 10 10" >
      <path d="M 0 0 L 7 0 L 3.5 7 z" style="fill:red; stroke:blue"/>
    </pattern> 
  </defs>

  <!-- Outline the drawing area in blue -->
  <rect style="fill:none; stroke:blue"
        x="1" y="1" width="798" height="398"/>

  <!-- The ellipse is filled using a triangle pattern paint server
       and stroked with black -->
  <ellipse style="fill:url(#TrianglePattern); stroke:black" 
           cx="400" cy="200" rx="350" ry="150" />
</svg>
